meanings.definition: A policy or system of segregation or discrimination on grounds of race.
meanings.sent1: The apartheid in the country separated people based on their race.
meanings.sent2: During apartheid, certain groups were unfairly treated because of their race.
meanings.sent3: The strict apartheid rules made it hard for people to interact freely.
meanings.sent4: The apartheid in society created invisible barriers between different racial groups.
meanings.sent5: Living under apartheid meant facing constant discrimination and inequality.

meanings.definition: The former policy of segregation and political and economic discrimination against non-European groups in the Republic of South Africa.
meanings.sent1: In the past, apartheid in South Africa caused great suffering for many people.
meanings.sent2: The effects of apartheid are still felt by communities in South Africa today.
meanings.sent3: Despite its dark history, apartheid has taught valuable lessons about equality.
meanings.sent4: The scars of apartheid run deep in the history of South Africa.
meanings.sent5: The struggle against apartheid united people in the fight for justice and freedom.
